main event: On 15 July 1953, a witness reported observing an unidentified object, described as a white light, moving in the sky over Brooklyn, New York.
interesting points: The object was observed at a height of 45 degrees and an azimuth of 270 degrees,The sighting lasted approximately 5 minutes before the object was lost from sight,The witness mentioned that it seemed to get faster and went straight up suddenly,The object was described as metallic and glistened in the sunlight,The conclusion of the report suggested that the observation matched the description of a probable meteor.
sighted object: single white light in the sky
witness description: A 37-year-old male strip clerk with some technical training as a radio operator.
